FDG.function_description: Manage data collection forms
The page functions as the main menu for ODK Collect, providing options to fill, edit, send, view, get, or delete data collection forms, along with a dropdown for additional settings and information.

core_logic.logic: The main menu of ODK Collect is the entry point. From here, the user can click the 'more options' dropdown (three dots) to open a menu with additional settings and information options like About, General Settings, or Admin Settings. This action initiates the flow to access these supplementary options.

steps.summary: Click the more options dropdown to open additional settings/info menu

FDG.function_description: The "Fill Blank Form" page is intended to display and allow interaction with blank data collection forms, but currently shows a message indicating no forms are available and suggests obtaining and filling out a blank form.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Main Menu page and clicks the 'Fill Blank Form' button. This navigates to the Fill Blank Form page, which displays a message indicating no forms are available and suggests getting a blank form. There are no further interactive steps here as the form list is empty.

steps.summary: Click 'Fill Blank Form' button on Main Menu to navigate to Fill Blank Form page

FDG.function_description: The "Edit Saved Form" page is intended to display and allow editing of previously saved data collection forms, but currently shows a message indicating no saved forms are available and suggests getting a blank form to fill out.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Main Menu page. They click the 'Edit Saved Form' button, which navigates to the Edit Saved Form page. On this page, a message indicates no saved forms are available, and suggests getting a blank form to fill out. There are no further interactive steps here as the page has no editable content.

steps.summary: Click 'Edit Saved Form' button on Main Menu

FDG.function_description: The "Send Finalized Form" page is used to send finalized data collection forms, and currently indicates there are no finalized forms available to send, prompting the user to finalize saved forms first.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Main Menu page and clicks 'Send Finalized Form' to navigate to the Send Finalized Form page. On this page, the user sees a message indicating no finalized forms are available, prompting them to finalize saved forms first. The user can then click the menu icon to access additional options like settings or view changes.

steps.summary: Click 'Send Finalized Form' from Main Menu to navigate to its management page
Click menu icon on Send Finalized Form page to access options

FDG.function_description: The "View Sent Form" page is intended to display previously sent data collection forms, but currently shows a message indicating no sent forms are available to display and suggests sending finalized forms first.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Main Menu page. They click the 'View Sent Form' button, which navigates to the 'View Sent Form' page. On this page, a message is displayed indicating no sent forms are available and suggesting to send finalized forms first. There are no further actions or branches here as the flow ends with viewing the message.

steps.summary: Click 'View Sent Form' button on Main Menu to navigate to View Sent Form page

FDG.function_description: The current page is the main menu of ODK Collect, providing options to fill, edit, send, view, get, or delete data collection forms, and in this context, it is in the process of connecting to a server to retrieve a blank form after the "Get Blank Form" action was initiated from the "Manage data collection forms" page.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the main menu page of ODK Collect. The user initiates the 'Get Blank Form' action by clicking the corresponding button. This action triggers a transition to a state where a 'Connecting to server' dialog is displayed, indicating the app is attempting to retrieve the blank form from the server.

steps.summary: Click 'Get Blank Form' button to start connecting to server for blank form retrieval

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to view and potentially delete saved data collection forms, with a current state showing no saved forms are available to display.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the main menu page and clicks the 'Delete Saved Form' button to navigate to the deletion page. On the deletion page, the user clicks to switch to the 'Saved Forms' tab, where the UI shows no saved forms are available to display.

steps.summary: Click 'Delete Saved Form' to navigate to the deletion page
Click to switch to 'Saved Forms' tab

FDG.function_description: The "About" page of ODK Collect provides options to visit the ODK website, join the ODK forum, share the app, leave a Play Store review, and view open source libraries/licenses, along with brief descriptions of each option's purpose.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Main Menu page. The user clicks the 'About' option, which navigates to the About page of ODK Collect. On the About page, options like visiting the ODK website, joining the forum, sharing the app, leaving a review, and viewing open source details are presented, each with a descriptive purpose.

steps.summary: Click 'About' option to navigate to ODK Collect's About page

FDG.function_description: The General Settings page allows users to configure various app - wide settings including Server, User interface, Maps, Form management, and User and device identity.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts at the Main Menu page. The user clicks on the 'General Settings' option, which navigates to the General Settings page where various app - wide settings (Server, User interface, Maps, Form management, User and device identity) can be configured. There are no branches or loops in this initial flow as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click on General Settings option to navigate to General Settings page

FDG.function_description: The Admin Settings page provides options for administrators to manage various system settings including general settings, password, application reset, import/export, user access control, main menu, user settings, and form entry settings.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Admin Settings option from the main menu to access the admin settings page. Then, the 'Reset application...' option is clicked to navigate to the data reset selection page. Finally, the 'Toggle map layers reset' action is performed to manage the map layers reset setting.

steps.summary: Click Admin Settings option to open admin settings page
Click Reset application... option to go to data reset page
Toggle map layers reset setting

FDG.function_description: The current page provides sorting options (by name in ascending/descending order, by date newest/oldest first) for blank forms within the "Fill Blank Form" management section, and indicates there are no forms available to display currently.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'Fill Blank Form' page (which shows no forms available). First, they click the menu navigation control to open the sorting options for blank forms. Then, at the sorting options page, they can choose to sort by Name A-Z or Name Z-A (the flow branches here based on the selected sorting option).

steps.summary: Click the menu navigation control to open sorting options for blank forms
Click 'Sort by Name, A-Z' to sort blank forms (if applicable)
Click 'Sort by Name, Z-A' to sort blank forms (if applicable)

FDG.function_description: This page provides a search interface to look for blank forms within the data collection form management system, with a message indicating no forms are currently available to display and a suggestion to get and fill out a blank form.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 2 and clicks the search function control to search for blank forms, navigating to page 108. Then, on page 108, the user clicks the search input field, moving to page 113. The flow is a straight sequence with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click search function control to search for blank forms
Click search input field

FDG.function_description: The current page provides sorting options (by name, date, or status) for saved forms within the "Edit Saved Form" management interface, allowing users to organize how saved forms are displayed.
data_out: sorted saved form list (by Name, A-Z)
updated saved form list (sorted by status, finalized first)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'Edit Saved Form' page (page 3) and clicks the menu icon to open the sorting options (page 114). At the sorting options page, the user can choose one of multiple sorting methods (e.g., Name A-Z, Name Z-A, Status finalized first), each leading back to the main form list page (page 3) with the selected sorting applied.

steps.summary: Click menu icon to open sorting options
Click 'Sort by Name, A-Z' option
Click 'Sort by Name, Z-A' option
Click 'Sort by Status, finalized first' option

FDG.function_description: This page provides a search functionality to locate saved data collection forms, with a message indicating no forms are currently available to display and suggesting the user get and fill out a blank form.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 3 and clicks the search icon to initiate form search (step S1), which navigates to page 115. Then, on page 115, the user clicks the search input field (step S2). The flow is a straight sequence with no branches, as the actions lead from the search trigger to the input interaction.

steps.summary: Click the search icon to start searching for saved forms
Click the search input field

FDG.function_description: The page provides sorting options (by name alphabetically, by date) for finalized forms in the "Send Finalized Form" management interface, allowing users to organize the list of forms to send.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the 'Send Finalized Form' page. The user clicks the filter icon (which provides sorting options) to open the sorting menu. This action leads to a new page (or menu) where sorting options for finalized forms are presented, allowing the user to choose a sorting criterion (e.g., by name alphabetically or by date) to organize the list of forms to send.

steps.summary: Click the filter icon to open sorting options for finalized forms

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to search for finalized forms that are ready to be sent, with a message indicating no forms are currently available and prompting to finalize saved forms first.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 4 and clicks the search icon to initiate a search for finalized forms (step S1). This action navigates to page 119, where the user then clicks the search input field (step S2). After this, the app displays a message indicating no forms are available and prompts to finalize saved forms first.

steps.summary: Click the search icon to start searching for finalized forms
Click the search input field

FDG.function_description: The page provides sorting options (by name in ascending/descending order, by date newest/oldest first) for organizing the list of sent data collection forms within the "View Sent Form" interface.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'View Sent Form' page (page 5). They click the menu icon (sorting options menu) to open the sorting menu, which navigates to page 125. The sorting menu provides options to sort sent forms by name (A-Z, Z-A) or date (newest first, oldest first), though the flow here captures the initial action to open the menu.

steps.summary: Click the menu icon to open the sorting options menu

FDG.function_description: The page provides a search interface to look for sent data collection forms, with a message indicating no forms are available to display and suggesting to send finalized forms first.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on page 5. First, the search icon is clicked to open the search interface for sent forms (navigating to page 126). Then, the search input field is clicked (on page 126, leading to page 127). The interface then shows a message if no forms are available, suggesting to send finalized forms first.

steps.summary: Click search icon to open sent forms search interface
Click search input field

FDG.function_description: The current page, under the "Blank Forms" tab, is used to display blank data collection forms, but currently shows no available forms to display.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7 and clicks the 'Blank Forms' tab to switch to it. After switching, the 'Blank Forms' page (page 128) is displayed, and it shows 'Nothing available to display' with no blank data collection forms present.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Blank Forms' tab to switch to it

FDG.function_description: The page provides sorting options (by name alphabetically or by date) for saved forms within the "Delete Saved Form" section, allowing users to organize how saved forms are displayed.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'Delete Saved Form' page (page 7). They click the menu icon to open the sort options for saved forms, which navigates to the sort menu page (page 129). At this point, the user can choose a sorting option (e.g., by name or date) to organize the saved forms, though the specific choice is not captured in the single action provided.

steps.summary: Click the menu icon to open sort options for saved forms

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to search for saved or blank data collection forms, with tabs to switch between viewing saved forms and blank forms, and currently shows no forms available for display.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 7 and clicks the search option to navigate to the form search page (page 130). On page 130, the user clicks the search input field. The page shows no forms available for display, with tabs to switch between saved and blank forms, but no further actions are needed as the display is empty.

steps.summary: Click the search option to navigate to the form search page
Click the search input field on the form search page

FDG.function_description: The page allows the user to select an application (e.g., Chrome, WebView Browser Tester) to open the link for visiting the ODK website from the ODK Collect about information page.
data_out: app selection for ODK website link

core_logic.logic: On the ODK Collect about page, the user clicks the 'Visit the ODK website' option. This triggers a dialog to select an app (e.g., Chrome, WebView Browser Tester) to open the link, allowing the user to choose how to navigate to the ODK website.

steps.summary: Click 'Visit the ODK website' to open app selection dialog

FDG.function_description: The current page allows the user to select an application (either Chrome or WebView Browser Tester) to open the link for visiting the ODK website from the ODK Collect about information page.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the ODK Collect about page. They click the 'Visit the ODK website' option, which triggers an 'Open with' dialog to appear, offering two browser choices: Chrome or WebView Browser Tester. The user then selects one of these browsers to open the ODK website link.

steps.summary: Click 'Visit the ODK website' to trigger browser selection dialog

FDG.function_description: The page provides options to share the ODK Collect app via different methods such as copying to clipboard, Gmail, Hangouts, Messenger, or saving to Drive.
data_out: sharing interface (with options: Copy to clipboard, Gmail, Hangouts, Messenger, Save to Drive)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the 'About' page. The user clicks the 'Share ODK Collect' option, which opens a sharing menu with multiple methods (Copy to clipboard, Gmail, Hangouts, Messenger, Save to Drive). The user can then choose one of these methods to share the app.

steps.summary: Click 'Share ODK Collect' to open sharing options

FDG.function_description: The current page allows the user to select a browser application (from options like Chrome or WebView Browser Tester) to open the link for visiting the ODK website, as part of the ODK Collect app's "About" section functionality.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'About' page of ODK Collect. They click on 'Visit the ODK website', which triggers a dialog to open the link with a browser. Then, the user selects a browser (Chrome or WebView Browser Tester) from the 'Open with' dialog to proceed to the ODK website.

steps.summary: Click 'Visit the ODK website' to trigger browser selection dialog

FDG.function_description: The page displays a list of open source libraries and their respective licenses used in the ODK Collect application.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 8 (About page). They click the 'Open source libraries/licenses' option, which navigates to page 13. On page 13, the list of open source libraries and their licenses is displayed. There are no branches or loops as the flow is a single click to view the list.

steps.summary: Click 'Open source libraries/licenses' to navigate to the licenses list page

FDG.function_description: The current page, "Server Settings", allows users to configure the server connection settings, including specifying the server type (ODK Aggregate), server URL, username, and password for the app's server connection.

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the 'Server settings' option to enter the Server Settings page. On this page, they can click the 'Username' or 'Password' fields to input credentials (with a dialog for each), or click the 'Type' option to select the server platform (choosing between ODK Aggregate or Other). The flow includes branches for entering username/password and selecting the server type.

steps.summary: Click 'Server settings' to navigate to Server Settings page
Click 'Username' field to open username input dialog
Click 'Password' field to open password input dialog
Click 'Type' option to open server platform selection dialog
Click username input field in dialog
Click 'OK' button in input dialog
Select 'ODK Aggregate' in platform dialog
Select 'Other' in platform dialog

branches.condition: User chooses to select server type

FDG.function_description: The current page allows users to configure user interface settings including theme, language, text font size, navigation method, splash screen visibility, and selected splash image.
data_out: updated text font size setting (Extra Large)
updated text font size setting (Extra Small)

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the user interface settings option (S1) to enter the UI settings page. Then, at the UI settings page, the user can choose to configure the theme (S2) or text font size (S3). For the theme branch (S2), the user can select either Light (S4) or Dark (S5) theme. For the text font size branch (S3), the user can select from Extra Large (S6), Large (S7), Medium (S8), Small (S9), or Extra Small (S10) font sizes.

steps.summary: Click to open user interface settings
Click to open theme selection dialog
Click to open text font size selection dialog
Select Light theme
Select Dark theme
Select Extra Large font size
Select Large font size
Select Medium font size
Select Small font size
Select Extra Small font size

FDG.function_description: The current page allows users to configure map settings, including selecting the Mapping SDK (e.g., Google Maps SDK) and the Basemap type (e.g., Streets).

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the General Settings page. They click the 'Maps' option to navigate to the Maps settings page, where they can configure the Mapping SDK and Basemap type. This is a straight - line flow with no branches or loops.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Maps' settings option to enter the Maps settings page

FDG.function_description: The current page, "Form management," allows users to configure various settings related to form updates (e.g., periodic checks, automatic download, hiding old versions), form submission (e.g., auto send, delete after send), and form filling (e.g., default to finalized, constraint processing) for data collection forms.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by navigating to Form management settings. Then, it proceeds to configure auto send options for form submission. At the auto send configuration step, there are mutually exclusive branches to select different auto send modes (Off, Wifi only, Cellular only, or Wifi or cellular). Additionally, there is a step to set the form to default to finalized.

steps.summary: Click to access Form management settings
Click to configure auto send for form submission
Select Off for auto send
Select Wifi only for auto send
Select Cellular only for auto send
Select Wifi or cellular for auto send
Set form to default to finalized

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to manage user and device identity settings, including configuring form metadata for identifying data submitters and toggling the collection of anonymous usage data to assist the ODK team in prioritizing fixes and features.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the General Settings page. They click the 'User and device identity' option, which navigates to the User and device identity settings page. This page allows managing form metadata for data submitter identification and toggling anonymous usage data collection.

steps.summary: Click 'User and device identity' option to navigate to its settings page

FDG.function_description: The General Settings page provides access to configure various system - related settings including Server, User interface, Maps, Form management, and User and device identity for the application.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Admin Settings page. The user clicks on the 'General Settings' option, which navigates to the General Settings page. This page provides access to configure various system - related settings including Server, User interface, Maps, Form management, and User and device identity.

steps.summary: Click on General Settings to navigate to its page

FDG.function_description: The current page is the main menu of the ODK Collect app, providing options to fill, edit, send, view, get, or delete data collection forms, along with access to additional options via a dropdown menu.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Admin Settings page. First, the user clicks the 'Admin Password' option to open the password change dialog. Then, at the dialog, the user can either click the new password input field to enter a password or click the OK button to confirm the change, with these two actions being mutually exclusive choices.

steps.summary: Click Admin Password to open password change dialog
Click new password input field
Click OK button to confirm password change

FDG.function_description: The Import/Export Settings page enables users to manage the import and export of settings (via QR code or SD card) and handle sensitive information like admin and server passwords associated with the QR code.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking to access the Import/Export Settings page. Once on this page, a user can either save settings (a leaf action) or select a code from the SD card (which triggers an app selection dialog). The main branch point is at the Import/Export Settings page, where the user chooses between saving settings or selecting a code from the SD card.

steps.summary: Click to open Import/Export Settings page
Click to save settings (leaf action)
Click to select code from SD card (triggers app selection)

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to manage the visibility of main menu items related to data collection forms by checking or unchecking options to show or hide them from the main menu.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Admin Settings page. They click on 'Main Menu Settings' to navigate to the page where they can manage the visibility of main menu items related to data collection forms. On the Main Menu Settings page, they can then check or uncheck the listed form-related menu items to show or hide them from the main menu.

steps.summary: Click on 'Main Menu Settings' to access the page for managing main menu item visibility

FDG.function_description: The User Settings page allows users to manage the visibility of various settings (e.g., Server, Theme, Language) by checking or unchecking options to show or hide them from General Settings.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on the Admin Settings page. The user clicks on the 'User Settings' option, which navigates to the User Settings page. On this page, the user can manage the visibility of various settings (like Server, Theme, Language) by checking or unchecking their respective checkboxes to show or hide them from General Settings.

steps.summary: Click on User Settings to navigate to its page

FDG.function_description: The Form Entry Settings page allows users to enable or disable various form entry-related options (e.g., Moving backwards, General Settings, Change Language, etc.) by checking or unchecking corresponding checkboxes.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the Admin Settings page. They click on the 'Form Entry Settings' option, which navigates to the Form Entry Settings page where various form entry - related options (like Moving backwards, General Settings, etc.) can be enabled or disabled via checkboxes.

steps.summary: Click on Form Entry Settings to navigate to its page

FDG.function_description: Sort by Date, newest first
data_out: updated form list (sorted by date, newest first)

core_logic.logic: On the initial page (page 107), the user performs a click action on the 'Sort by Date, newest first' option. This action transitions the app to the destination page (page 111), completing the sorting setup to display items in the newest-first date order.

steps.summary: Click on 'Sort by Date, newest first' option

FDG.function_description: Sort by Date, oldest first
data_out: updated form list (sorted by date, oldest first)

core_logic.logic: On the source page (page 107), the user performs a click action on the 'Sort by Date, oldest first' option. This action navigates to the destination page (page 112), completing the sorting operation as intended.

steps.summary: Click on 'Sort by Date, oldest first' option

FDG.function_description: The current page, reached after sorting saved forms by Name in reverse alphabetical order (Z - A) from the edit saved forms management page, displays a message indicating no saved forms are available and suggests getting and filling out a blank form.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the edit saved forms management page. A click action is performed to sort the saved forms by 'Date, newest first'. After this action, the page updates to display a message indicating no saved forms are available and suggests getting and filling out a blank form.

steps.summary: Click to sort by Date, newest first

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to view and potentially edit saved forms, with sorting options (like sorting by name in reverse alphabetical order) and a message indicating no saved forms are available, prompting users to get and fill out a blank form.
data_out: updated saved form list (sorted by date, oldest first)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the 'Edit Saved Form' page. They can click the sort menu (e.g., to select 'Date, oldest first') to sort saved forms. If no forms are saved, a message prompts them to get a blank form. The flow includes sorting actions and checking for saved forms.

steps.summary: Click to sort by Date, oldest first

FDG.function_description: The current page, reached after sorting saved forms by Name in Z - A order, displays a message indicating no saved forms are available and suggests getting and filling out a blank form, while also providing options for menu and search functionality related to saved forms.
data_out: updated saved form list (sorted by status, unfinalized first)

core_logic.logic: The process starts on page 114. A click action is performed to sort saved forms by Status (unfinalized first), leading to page 3. On page 3, the UI displays a message that no saved forms are available and suggests filling a blank form, with menu and search options present.

steps.summary: Click to sort saved forms by Status (unfinalized first)

FDG.function_description: The General Settings page provides options to configure settings related to Server, User interface, Maps, Form management, and User and device identity for the data collection form management application.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts at the entry page (page 120). The user clicks on the 'General Settings' option, which navigates to the General Settings page (page 9) where configuration options for Server, User interface, Maps, Form management, and User and device identity are available. There are no branches or loops in this initial flow as only one action is provided.

steps.summary: Click on General Settings option to navigate to General Settings page

FDG.function_description: The current page provides a "Change View" dialog with options to filter the display of forms as either "Show Unsent Forms" or "Show Sent and Unsent Forms" for the finalized forms management interface.

core_logic.logic: The process starts on the finalized forms management page (page 120). The user clicks the 'Change View' option, which opens a dialog (page 122) with two filtering options: 'Show Unsent Forms' and 'Show Sent and Unsent Forms'. The flow now branches based on which option the user selects to filter the form display.

steps.summary: Click 'Change View' to open the view - changing dialog

branches.condition: User selects 'Show Sent and Unsent Forms'

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to configure server connection settings for an ODK Aggregate server, including viewing or editing the server URL, username, and password, and accessing ODK Aggregate specific settings.

core_logic.logic: On the Server Settings page (page 14), the user clicks the 'ODK Aggregate settings' link. This action likely navigates to (or opens) the ODK Aggregate - specific settings page, allowing further configuration of server - related details for ODK Aggregate.

steps.summary: Click the 'ODK Aggregate settings' link on the Server Settings page

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to select the app's language from a list of available languages, with an option to use the device's language.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 15 and clicks the 'Language' setting to navigate to page 27. Then, on page 27, the user clicks a language option to complete the selection (page 33).

steps.summary: Click 'Language' setting to open language selection page
Click a language option to select it

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a dialog for selecting the mapping SDK (Google Maps SDK, OpenStreetMap SDK, or Mapbox Maps SDK) to be used within the app's navigation or mapping-related features.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts by clicking the Navigation setting to open the option selection dialog. Then, from the dialog, the user can choose one of three navigation options: horizontal swipes, forward/backward buttons, or both swipes and buttons, with each choice leading to a distinct page.

steps.summary: Click Navigation setting to open option dialog
Select 'Use horizontal swipes' option
Select 'Use forward/backward buttons' option
Select 'Use swipes and buttons' option

FDG.function_description: Splash screen toggle

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 15 (User interface settings). The core logic is to perform a click action on the 'Splash screen toggle' option, which likely toggles the splash screen setting (e.g., enabling or disabling it) and may navigate to a new page (30) or update the current page's state. There are no branches or loops here as it's a single action to toggle the setting.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Splash screen toggle' option to toggle its state (e.g., enable/disable splash screen on app start) and potentially navigate to page 30.

FDG.function_description: The current page, within the user interface settings of the app, allows the user to configure the selected splash image (along with other UI settings like theme, language, text font size, navigation, and splash screen visibility).

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the User interface settings page. The core logic involves clicking on the 'Selected splash image' setting, which likely allows configuration of the splash image (though the current action is a click to access or modify this setting). There are no branches or loops here as only one action is present.

steps.summary: Click on the 'Selected splash image' setting to configure the splash image

FDG.function_description: The current page allows the user to select a Mapping SDK (Google Maps SDK, OpenStreetMap SDK, or Mapbox Maps SDK) for the app's map functionality.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 16 (Maps settings). They click the 'Mapping SDK' setting, which opens a dialog (dst page 29) with options to select Google Maps SDK, OpenStreetMap SDK, or Mapbox Maps SDK. This click initiates the process of choosing a mapping SDK for the app's map functionality.

steps.summary: Click 'Mapping SDK' setting to open SDK selection dialog

FDG.function_description: The current page allows the user to select the type of basemap (Streets, Satellite, Terrain, Hybrid) for the map settings within the app.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 16 and clicks to open the basemap selection menu (step S1). Then, at the basemap selection page (step S2), the user chooses one of four options: Streets (S3), Satellite (S4), Terrain (S5), or Hybrid (S6), with each choice leading to a distinct destination page.

steps.summary: Open basemap selection menu
Select Streets basemap
Select Satellite basemap
Select Terrain basemap
Select Hybrid basemap

FDG.function_description: This page allows the user to configure the frequency (e.g., Never, Every fifteen minutes, Every hour, etc.) at which the app checks for periodic form updates within the form management settings.
data_out: updated periodic form updates check setting
updated periodic form updates check setting (Every fifteen minutes)
updated periodic form updates check setting (to Every hour)
updated periodic form updates check setting (Every six hours)
updated periodic form updates check setting (Every 24 hours)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the form management page and clicks to open the periodic form updates check settings. Then, from the list of frequency options (Never, Every fifteen minutes, Every hour, Every six hours, Every 24 hours), the user selects one to configure the update check frequency.

steps.summary: Open periodic form updates check settings
Select 'Never' frequency
Select 'Every fifteen minutes' frequency
Select 'Every hour' frequency
Select 'Every six hours' frequency
Select 'Every 24 hours' frequency

FDG.function_description: Enable automatic form download
